The business currently remained closed three months after the fact with no progress towards a solution made. Due to the degree of economic ostracism that the Bahá’í community faces in Iran, the community relies heavily on small service / retail businesses for their livelihood.

At noon on May 14, agents from the Ministry of Intelligence in South Khorasan province, acting without a warrant, searched the home of Muhammad Hussein Nakh`i in the small town of Khusf. They seized some Bahai books, an album of family photographs and a telephone book, and took Mr. Nakh`i for questioning. He was later arrested. Mr. Nakh`i is 85 years old, and his wife is 88 years old. He has already served five years in prison for being a Bahai, following the 1979 revolution in Iran.
title: Bahai man aged 85 arrested (Muhammad Hussein Nakh'i)

description: On May 27, a vertical blinds factory belonging to Fariborz Wahdat-Sho`ar ( فریبرز وحدت شعار ), and a lens-making shop belonging to Afrasayab Khanjani ( افراسیاب خانجانی ), both Bahais living in Semnan, were shut down by the authorities. No clear reason has been given, but it is likely they were shut down because they have closed for the day on a Bahai Holy Day. The two businesses together employed at least 70 workers, of whom 14 were Bahais. They are now out of work. In recent months, 14 shops and workshops belonging to Bahais have been closed, or had their operating licences withdrawn, in Semnan alone, leaving some 50 Bahais (and an unspecified number of other Iranians) out of work.
title: Two Baha'I businesses closed in Semnan (Fariborz Wahdat-Sho’ar and Afrasayab Khanjani)

description: Four Bahais who are serving prison sentences in Semnan have been interrogated again, for several hours. Afshin Iqani, Siamak Iqani, Behfar Khanjani and `Ali Ehsani were transferred to the Ministry of Intelligence on May 6, and returned to Semnan prison after their interrogation. All have served more than one year year in prison: it is not clear what the purpose of an interrogation could be. Behfar Khanjani and Afshin Iqani have been sentenced to four years and three months, Siamak Iqani to three years, and `Ali Ehsani to two years in prison.
title: Four Bahai prisoners in Semnan interrogated again ( Afshin Iqani, Siamak Iqani, Behfar Khanjani and `Ali Ehsani )

description: On January 5th security forces visited the trading property of Arman Safa’i, a Bahá’í resident who comes from Sari. A laptop containing financial information was taken on the pretext that there was music on it. Despite no faults being found, Safa’i’s business was shut down regardless. Additionally all legal dues were paid and the business was operating in accordance to its issued licence.
title: Baha'i business closed in Sari
Iran’s Minister of Intelligence to present plan for dealing with Bahais
description: A spokesman for the “Article 90″ committee in Iran’s parliamentary system has stated that the Minister of Intelligence will present a report to the committee on ways of dealing with “deviant sects” — a term usually referring to Bahais and sometimes to Sunni Muslims. The Minister will discuss ongoing correspondence between the Minister and the committee, and UN resolutions relating to human rights in Iran.

title: Bahai student expelled from Semnan University (Nilisa Yahyahvi)
description: Two years ago, Nilisa Yahyahvi ( نیلیسا یحیوی ), a graduate in Persian language and culture, was barred from university studies with the excuse “file incomplete” — a euphemism used to disguise religious discrimination in Iran’s education system. In this academic year she again applied, and was admitted to a Master’s course at Semnan University. She attended classes until one week before her expulsion, when university officials asked for her BA diploma and a few day later, contacted her by telephone to ask some questions about her religious beliefs. She was then told that she was barred from further study at the University.

title: One arrest in Gorgan ( Mozhde Zohuri )
description: On the morning of December 24, agents from the Ministry of Intelligence in Iran arrested Mozhde Zohuri, ( مژده ظهوری ) in her home in Mashhad. They also searched her home and seized religious books, a mobile phone and some personal effects. Mozhde Zohuri is the wife of Farhad Fahandezh (فرهاد فهندژ), who was arrested in his home on October 16, 2012, and later transferred first to Evin prison and then to Raja’i Shahr, before being sentenced to 10 years in prison. He is serving his sentence in Raja’i Shahr.

title: Another Bahai business closed in Tonekabon
description: On November 12, security forces closed the business of three Bahais in Nashtarud, Tonekabon county, until further notice. This is the second such closure in a month. The names of the Bahais involved in the business this time are Armeen and Michel Esma`ilour and Badi`ullah Abu-al-Fasli ( آرمین اسماعیل پور، میشل اسماعیل پور و بدیع الله ابوالفضلی ). They had previously been summoned and interrogated several times.

title: Home searches and arrest of Bahai youth in Semnan ( Ardeshir Fana’ayan, Awrakhsh and Na’im Hedayati and Saroush Firuzayan)
description: Security agents have raided homes and arrested young Bahais in Semnan, under the pretext of enforcing the military service law. They carried a letter from someone called Zaman, an assistant prosecutor. They raided the homes of Bahais who sons are eligible for military service. After a thorough search and turning the homes upside down, they seized religious books, computers and personal items, arrested the young men and handed them over to the police. Those arrested were held for one day and released after signing a form that they would present themselves whenever they are summoned. At the time of writing, those arrested and released are known to include Ardeshir Fana’ayan, Awrakhsh and Na’im Hedayati and Saroush Firuzayan ( اردشیر فناییان، اورخش هدایتی، نعیم هدایتی و سروش فیروزیان ). One of the Bahais went to the Police Office to ask the reason for this procedure and was told that the military call-up law had been disused for some years, and that its application to the Bahais had been initiated by other agencies.

title: Home searches and arrest of Bahai youth in Semnan ( Ardeshir Fana’ayan, Awrakhsh and Na’im Hedayati and Saroush Firuzayan)
description: Security agents have raided homes and arrested young Bahais in Semnan, under the pretext of enforcing the military service law. They carried a letter from someone called Zaman, an assistant prosecutor. They raided the homes of Bahais who sons are eligible for military service. After a thorough search and turning the homes upside down, they seized religious books, computers and personal items, arrested the young men and handed them over to the police. Those arrested were held for one day and released after signing a form that they would present themselves whenever they are summoned. At the time of writing, those arrested and released are known to include Ardeshir Fana’ayan, Awrakhsh and Na’im Hedayati and Saroush Firuzayan ( اردشیر فناییان، اورخش هدایتی، نعیم هدایتی و سروش فیروزیان ). One of the Bahais went to the Police Office to ask the reason for this procedure and was told that the military call-up law had been disused for some years, and that its application to the Bahais had been initiated by other agencies.

title: Keyvan Dehqani begins his sentence in Mashhad
description: Keyvan Dehqani ( کیوان دهقانی ), a Bahai from Isfahan, was taken to Vakil Abad prison in Mashhad on November 14, to begin serving his sentence. In September 2012 the review court for the Province of Khorasan sentenced him to 6 months in prison. He was arrested at a Bahai celebration — the Feast of Rahmat — in Isfahan on July 12, 2011 and was taken to the Ministry of Intelligence branch in Mashhad. He was initially sentenced to 18 months in prison, on charges of propaganda against the regime in the form of teaching the Bahai Faith. The review court reduced this sentence to six months.

title: Clerical organization claims title of all Baha'i properties
description: A clerical organization called the Foundation of the Dispossessed claimed title to all Baha'i properties, and turned over the house of the Bab, the holiest Baha'i shrine in Iran, to the prominent mullah, Sheykh Sadeq Khalkhali

title: Husayn Shakuri executed
description: Husayn Shakuri was executed in Oshnavieh, a city in North Western Iran, for unknown charges.
Shaykh Muhammad Muvahhid was abducted and never seen again.
title: Shaykh Muhammad Muvahhid abducted
National Baha'i Center converted to Islamic University
description: An announcement was made that the National Baha'i Headquarters in Tehran was to be converted into an Islamic University.
The House of the Bab, one of the holiest Baha'i sites, was demolished by authorities. The site was made into a public square
title: House of the Bab Destroyed

description: Bahar Vujdani, a businessman in the city of Mahabad, was charged with "anti-revolutionary activity" and executed.
title: Bahar Vujdani executed
Dr. Ali Murad Davoodi abducted
description: Dr. Ali Murad Davoodi was abducted and never seen again.

title: Ministry of Education demands dismissal of Baha'i teachers
description: An edict from the Ministry of Education required the dismissal of all Baha'i teachers, and held them responsible for repaying all salaries they had received

title: Azematollah Fahandezh executed
description:
Azematollah Fahandezh, a colonel with the armed forces, was executed.

He was allegedly charged with mass murder

title: Rouhi Roushani abducted
description: Rouhi Roushani, the secretary of the Local Spiritual Assembly of Tehran, was abducted by revolutionary guards

title: Habibu'llah Panahi Assasinated
description: Habibu'llah Panah was assassinated in the town of Orumieh. Charges against him are unknown

title: Kamal Yazdan-Panah dismissed from army
description: After more than 13 years of faithful service, Kamal Yazdan-Panah was dismissed from the army, and no explanations or compensations were offered.

title: Badi'u'llah Yazdani Executed
description: Badi'u'llah Yazdani, a resident of Tehran, was executed

title: Ghulam-Husayn A'zami executed
description: Ghulam-Husayn A'zami, a resident of Tehran, was executed for alleged religious offences.

title: Ali-Akbar Mu'ini executed
description: Ali-Akbar Mu'ini was executed in Tehran

title: Parviz Bayani executed
description: Parviz Bayani, a resident of the West Azerbaijan city of Piranshahr, was executed

title: Hasan Isma'ilzadih killed
description: Hasan Isma'ilzadih was killed in the city of Sandanj

title: Yusuf Sabhani executed
description: Sabhani - a highly regarded member of the Tehran Baha'i community - was executed.

title: Faramarz Samandari executed
description: Dr Faramarz Samandari, a physician and professor at the University of Tabriz, was arrested and executed on the same night.

title: Yadu'llah Astani executed
description: Yadu'llah Astani, a member of the Local Spiritual Assembly of Tabriz, was executed.

title: Muhammad Akbari executed.
description: Muhammad Akbari, from the city of Rasht, was executed.

title: Mahmud Rajabi Ezzat-Abadi terminated from work
description:
After serving the Islamic Republic of Iran Broadcasting for over 3 years, Mahmud Ezzat-Abadi was fired. 

A note later revealed that the termination was caused by the Commission to Sanitize the Workplace (from Baha'is).

title: Dhabih'llah Mu'mini executed
description: Dhabih'llah Mu'mini, from Tehran, was executed.

title: Members of National Spiritual Assembly abducted
description:
All 9 members of the National Spiritual Assembly of Iran were abducted and disappeared without a trace.

It is believed that they were executed

title: 3 administrators executed (Nuru'llah Akhtar-Khavari, Azizu'llah Dhabihiyan and Firaydun Faridani)
description: Nuru'llah Akhtar-Khavari, Azizu'llah Dhabihiyan and Firaydun Faridani, who were Auxiliary Board Members, were executed in Yazd

title: Mahmud Hasanzadih Executed
description: Mahmud Hasanzadih, from Yazd, was executed.

title: 2 members of Yazd LSA executed (Ali Mutahhari and Jalal Mustaqim)
description: Ali Mutahhari and Jalal Mustaqim, members of the Yazd Local Spiritual Assembly, were executed.

title: Mahmud Hasanzadih Executed
description: Mahmud Hasanzadih, from Yazd, was executed.

title: Rida Firuzi executed
description: Rida Firuzi, from Yazd, was executed

title: Couple Burned to Death in Birjand (Shikkar-Nisa Ma'sumi & Husayn Ma'sumi)
description:
Shikkar-Nisa Ma'sumi (right) and her husband Muhammad-Husayn Ma'sumi were burned to death in Birjand.

15 masked men broke into their home at the middle of the night and proceeded to pour kerosene on Muhammad, then set him on fire. He was then forced to run for several meters, before wood was heaped on him.

His wife was met with a similar treatment and died in hospital two days later.

title: Bihruz Sana'i executed
description: Bihruz Sana'i, from Tehran, was executed.

title: Manuchihr Hakim - Chairman of NSA - assassinated
description:
Manuchihr Hakim, Chairman of the National Spiritual Assembly of Iran, was executed in his clinic.

A few days after the assassination, authorities produced documents authorizing the confiscation of his properties.

title: Two men executed in Shiraz (Mihdi Anvari & Hidayatu'llah Dihqani)
description: Mihdi Anvari and Hidayatu'llah Dihqani were executed in Shiraz

title: Nuraniyyih Yarshatir assassinated
description: Nuraniyyih Yarshatir, from the city of Shiraz, was assassinated

title: 3 Executed in Shiraz (Yadu'llah Vahdat, Sattar Khushkhu, Ihsanu'llah, Mihdi-Zadih)
description: Yadu'llah Vahdat, Sattar Khushkhu and Ihsanu'llah Mihdi-Zadih were executed in Shiraz.

title: 7 members of Hamadan spiritual assembly executed ( Muhmmad (Suhrab) Habibi, Mr. Muhammad-Baqir (Suhayl) Habibi, Husayn Khandil, Tarazu’llah Khuzayn, Husayn Mutlaq, Firuz Na’imi, and Nasir Vafa’i)
description:
Seven members of the Hamadan spiritual assembly were executed by firing squad. While the bodies were being prepared for the funeral, it was revealed that six had been tortured.

The victims were: Muhmmad (Suhrab) Habibi, Mr. Muhammad-Baqir (Suhayl) Habibi, Husayn Khandil, Tarazu’llah Khuzayn, Husayn Mutlaq, Firuz Na’imi, and Nasir Vafa’i

title: Hashin Farnush executed (member of LSA)
description: Hashin Farnush, a member of the Local Spiritual Assembly of Tehran, was executed.

title: Farhang Maveddat executed
description:
Farhang Maveddat, a member of the Local Spiritual Assembly of Tehran, was executed.

Mr. Maveddat was arrested by the Karaj Islamic Committee when his house was raided. He was taken to Evin Prison and detained there for 7 months before his execution. He was denied visitation with his family and access to an attorney during his detention

title: Buzurg Alaviyan executed
description: Buzurg Alaviyan, a member of the Local Spiritual Assembly of Tehran, was executed along with 2 others.

title: Masih Farhangi executed
description:
Dr. Masih Farhangi, a member of the Continental Board of Counsellors for Asia, was executed.

The words "Enemy of Islam" were found written on his leg

title: Members of Tabriz LSA executed
description: Abdul-Ali Asadyari, Husayn Asadu’llah-Zadeh, Mihdi Bahiri, Masrur Dakhili, Parviz Firuzi, Manuchihr Khadi’i, Habibu’llah Tahqiqi, Isma’il Zihtab, Habibu’llah ‘Azizi -members of the Tabriz LSA - were executed

title: 5 men executed in Isfahan
description: Bahman Atifi, Izzat Atifi, Ahmad Ridvani, Ata'u'llah Rawhani and Gushtasb Thabit-Rasikh  were executed in

title: Yadu'llah Sipihr-Arfa' executed
description: Yadu'llah Sipihr-Arfa' was executed in Tehran.

title: Baha'i National Spiritual Assembly leaders arrested
description: Eight of the nine newly elected members were arrested by Iranian authorities following a meeting, and were subjected to rigorous daily interrogations.

title: House of Baha'u'llah in Takur destroyed
description: The house of Baha'u'llah in Takur was completely demolished, and its land and gardens were offered for sale to the public.

title: Members of National Spiritual Assembly executed
description:
8 members of the newly elected National Spiritual Assembly were arrested, and executed without trial a few days later.

Kamran Samimi, Sirus Rawshani Uskui, Qudratu'llah Rawhani, Mahmud Majdhub, Izzat’u’llah Furuhi, Jalal Azizi, Mehdi Amin Amin and Jinus Ni'mat Mahmudi

title: 7 members of Tehran LSA executed
description:
7 elected members of the Tehran Local Spiritual Assembly were executed.

The 7 LSA members were: Shiva Mahmudi Asadu'llah-Zadeh, Iskandar Azizi, Shidrukh َAmir Kiya' Baqa, Fathu'llah Firdawsi, Khusraw Muhandisi, Kurush Tala'i and Ata'u'llah Yavari

title: Ibrahim Khayrkhah executed
description: Ibrahim Khayrkhah was executed in Tehran

title: Husayn Vahdat-i-Haq executed
description: Husayn Vahdat-i-Haq was executed in Tehran

title: Askar Muhammadi assasinated
description:
Armed assailants broke into the house of Askar Muhammadi, and shot him in the back.

When confronted by his brother, they simply stated: "“He was a Bahá’í, and to kill a Bahá’í is a good deed for devout Muslims.”"

title: Ihsanu'llah Khayyami executed
description: Ihsanu'llah Khayyami was executed in Orumieh, capital of the West Azerbaijan province.

title: Abbas Idilkhani imprisoned
description: Abbas Idilkhani, an air conditioning technician, was arrested in Zanjan along with his wife

title: Azizu'llah Gulshani executed
description:
Azizu'llah Gulshani, a Baha'i from Mashhad, was executed.

The charges against Mr. Gulshani, as reported by Jomhuri Eslami, were: “promoting the dirty, non-Islamic sect of Bahaism in the Islamic Republic of Iran as well as promoting it abroad through his son. Plundering the national treasury in order to strengthen the sect of Bahaism among the students of this sect, writing essays on the related subject, trips to Israel and helping the usurper Zionist government of Israel.”

title: 3 Members of Karaj LSA Executed (Ishraqiyyih Furuhar, Mahmud Furuhar and Badi'u'llah Haqpaykar)
description: Ishraqiyyih Furuhar, Mahmud Furuhar and Badi'u'llah Haqpaykar were executed in Karaj. They were elected members of the Local Spiritual Assembly

title: 2 executed in Orumieh (Agahu'llah Tizfahm and Jalaliyyih Mushta il Usku'i)
description: Agahu'llah Tizfahm and Jalaliyyih Mushta il Usku'i were executed in Orumieh

title: Iran Rahimpur executed
description: Iran Rahimpur (Khurma'i) was executed in the southwestern city of Dezful.

title: 2 Men executed in Tehran (Nasru'llah Amini and Sa'du'llah Babazadeh)
description: Nasru'llah Amini and Sa'du'llah Babazadeh were executed in Tehran. Both were members of the elected Local Spiritual Assembly

title: Ata'u'llah Haqqani was killed in Iran
description: Ata'u'llah Haqqani was killed in Iran

title: 4 members of Qazvin LSA executed (Mohammad Abbasi, Jadidu'llah Ashraf, Manuchihr Farzanih Mu'ayyad and Muhammad Mansuri)
description:
Mohammad Abbasi, Jadidu'llah Ashraf, Manuchihr Farzanih Mu'ayyad and Muhammad Mansuri were executed in Qazvin.

The four were elected members of the Qazvin Local Spiritual Assembly.

title: Manuchihr Vafa'i assassinated
description: Manuchihr Vafa'i was assassinated in Tehran

title: Manuchihr Vafa'i assassinated
description: Manuchihr Vafa'i was assassinated in Tehran

title: Abbas-Ali Sadiqipur executed
description: Abbas-Ali Sadiqipur was executed in Shiraz

title: Ali Na'imiyan executed
description: Ali Na'imiyan was executed in the town of Orumieh

title: Jamshid Siyavushi Arrested
description:
Jamshid Siyavushi, a businessman and treasurer of the Shiraz Local Spiritual Assembly, was arrested from his uncle's home. 

As he had information on the community's finances and addresses of members, Mr. Siyavushi was routinely tortured and deprived from food and sleep. 

It was reported that due to the pressures place on Mr. Siyavushi, he attempted suicide.

title: Tuba Za'irpur arrested
description:
Tuba Za'irpur, a retired teacher, was arrested when several revolutionary guards arrived at her home and produced an arrest warrant for Qudsiyyih Za'iri, despite her pleas that that was not her name.

Falsely believing that she was an administrator at the Local Spiritual Assembly, Tuba was subjected to intense interrogation sessions during her period of imprisonment and severe torture.

title: Yalda'i family arrested
description: Armed members of the Revolutionary Guards raided the home of the Yalda'i family a few minutes after the conclusion of a meeting.

title: Bahram Afnan arrested
description:
Dr. Bahram Afnan, head of the internal medicine ward at Fars Regional Medical Center in Shiraz, was arrested while on his way to work. 

As an elected member of the Local Spiritual Assembly, and a prominent figure in the community, he was frequently targetted by prison guards. He suffered two heart attacks while in prison.

title: Habibu'llah Awji executed
description: Habibu'llah Awji was executed in Shiraz.

title: Dhiya'u'llah Ahrari executed
description: Dhiya'u'llah Ahrari was executed in Shiraz. He was an elected member of the Local Spiritual Assembly.

title: Abdu'l-Husayn Azadi arrested
description:
Abdu'l-Husayn Azadi, a veterinarian employed by the Ministry of Health and an elected Local Spiritual Assembly member was arrested at his home in Akbarabad.

During his period of detention, he was severely beaten and suffered from lung and intestinal problems.

title: Family arrested in Shiraz (Inayatu'llah Ishraqi)
description: Inayatu'llah Ishraqi, a retired employee of the Iranian National Oil Company, was arrested along with his wife and daughter.

title: Kurush Haqbin arrested
description:
Kurush Haqbin, a technician and an elected member of the Marvdasht Local Spiritual Assembly, was arrested.

During his period of incarceration, Mr. Haqbin was tortured in an attempt to convince him to recant his faith

title: Guldanih Alipur killed by a mob in Sari
description: Guldanih Alipur was killed by a mob in Sari
Hidayatu'llah Siyavushi, a member of the Local Spiritual Assembly of Shiraz, was executed in the Adelabad prison in Shiraz.
title: Hidayatu'llah Siyavushi executed
2 LSA Members executed (Yadu'llah Mahmudnizhad, Rahmatu'llah Vafa'i)
description: Yadu'llah Mahmudnizhad and Rahmatu'llah Vafa'i were executed in Shiraz following several months' imprisonment for refusing to recant their faith

title: Tuba Za'irpur executed
description: 5 months after her arrest, Ms Za'irpur was executed in Adelabad prison in Shiraz (along with 2 other Baha'is), after refusing to recant her faith.

title: Adadu'llah (Aziz) Zaydi Killed
description: Adadu'llah (Aziz) Zaydi was killed in the city of Miandoab in North-Western Iran.

title: 2 men executed in Tehran (Suhayl Safa'i and Jalal Hakiman)
description:
Suhayl Safa'i and Jalal Hakiman were executed in Tehran. 

Mr Safa'i was active in teaching Baha'i youth and was compiling a Baha'i encylopedia. His extensive library and all his notes were confiscated upon his arrest, yet weren't returned to his family after his execution. His family only received his shoes and small bag.

title: 6 men executed in Shiraz
description:
6 men (4 of whom were administrators at Local Assemblies) were executed in Shiraz after refusing to recant their faith.

Those executed were: Bahram Afnan, Abdu'l-Husayn Azadi, Kurush Haqbin, Inayatu'llah Ishraqi, Bahram Yalda'i and Jamshid Siyavushi

title: Ten Baha'i women executed
description: Ten Baha'i women, the youngest of whom was only 17, were executed. Their charge: teaching Baha'i children more about their faith.
Suhayl Hushmand was executed in Shiraz after refusing to recant his faith
title: Suhayl Hushmand executed
Over 130 Baha'is held captive; denied food
description:
In the village of Nal (near Sari), over 130 Baha'is were held captive for 3 days in a walled-in field and denied food and water.

The group, which included women and children, were held in an effort to pressure them into recanting their faith.

However, on the same day of their release, the Baha'is were attacked by villagers and forced to hide in a forest

title: Baha'i institutions banned
description: Revolutionary Prosecutor General of the Islamic Republic of Iran, Siyyid Husayn Musavi Tabrizi, declared in a press interview that Baha'i religious organizations were illegal and participation in them was a criminal act

title: Muhammad Ishraqi died in prison
description: Muhammad Ishraqi, an Auxiliary Board Member, died while in custody.

title: Licenses of 32 lawyers withdrawn
description: At the orders of the Central Court of the Islamic Revolution, the licenses of 32 Baha'i attorneys were withdrawn.

title: Akbar Haqiqi mobbed
description: Akbar Haqiqi was mobbed in the town of Khoy in West Azerbaijan.

title: Bahman Dihqani mobbed
description: Bahman Dihqani was mobbed in Kerman

title: Abdul-Mjid Mutahhar died in prison
description: Abdul-Majid Mutahhar died while he was imprisoned in Isfahan

title: Yazdan-Panah residence raided
description: Armed personnel raided the home of the Yazda-Panah family in the village of Ekhtiyar-Abad proceeded to insult and denigrate the family.

title: Ahmad Bashiri executed
description: Ahmad Bashiri, a member of the National Spiritual Assembly that was disbanded in August 1983, was executed after 15 months imprisonment.

title: Rahmatu’llah Hakiman died in prison,
description: Rahmatu’llah Hakiman was executed while in detention in Kerman

title: Fidrus Shabrukh executed
description: Fidrus Shabrukh was executed in Zahedan

title: Another student expelled for Bahai beliefs (Farshad Farzan)
description: Farshad Farzan (فرشاد فرزان), a student at the Shahid Bahonar school of engineering and technology in Shiraz, has been expelled because of his Bahai beliefs. He began a course in business accounting at the university in October 2011 and earned a preparatory qualification. He was then admitted to the Bachelor’s degree course, but was expelled on January 21, 2014, after completing one semester of study, because of his Bahai beliefs. He was not only denied further study, the university credits he had earned in his first semester were denied to him.

tags.title: Shahid Bahonar school of engineering and technology

title: Two Bahai businesses closed in Karaj (Saman and Badi`I Ashkar)
description: On the morning of February 16, a business owned by two Bahais, Saman and Badi`i Ashkar (سامان بدیعی و اشکان بدیعی ), was closed by the local authorities of Karaj, and their business licence was revoked. The action was taken because of their religious beliefs, and flimsy pretexts.

title: Bahai homes raided in Yazd (Rostam Behifarr, Ramin Hosuri, Majid Qane`, Mehran Basiri and Mehran Bandi)
description: On February 19, police carrying search warrants raided the homes of Rostam Behifarr, Ramin Hosuri, Majid Qane`, Mehran Basiri and Mehran Bandi (رستم بهی فر، رامین حصوری، مجید قانع، مهران بصیری و مهران بندی). They seized some personal effects, books and computers, but did not arrest anyone.

The Court of Review for the Province of Khorasan has confirmed the sentences of four Bahais from Mashhad who have been sentenced to prison because of their religious beliefs. Nika and Nava Khalusi (نیکا و نوا خلوصی ) have had their sentences of six years and 4 and a half years in prison, respectively, confirmed. The sentence of Adib Sho`a`i (ادیب شعاعی) was reduced from 18 months to six months, and the sentence of Mahsa Mahdavi was reduced from eight months to three months and one day. All four were charged with membership of the Bahai organisation, participation in illegal Bahai activities, and propaganda in favour of the Bahais and against the regime of the Islamic Republic.

Update: March 25th 2014
Leva Khanjani ( لواء خانجانی ), a Bahai serving a two-year sentence in Evin prison, has been granted furlough for Naw Ruz. Leva Khanjani is a student excluded from education because of her Bahai beliefs. She was arrested on January 3, 2010, along with her husband Babak Mobasher, on the pretext that they had participated in street protests following the 2009 elections.
title: Sentences confirmed for four Bahais in Mashhad (Nika and Nava Khalusi, Adib Sho`a`I, Mahsa Mahdavi)
Ghulam-Husayn Hasanzadih-Shakiri Executed
description: Ghulam-Husayn Hasanzadih-Shakiri was executed in Tehran for his religious beliefs

title: Muhsin Radavi died in prison
description: Muhsin Radavi died while imprisoned in Tehran

title: Nusrat’ullah Diya'i died in prison
description: Nusrat’ullah Diya'i died while imprisoned in Kerman

title: 3 men executed in Tehran (Kamran Lotfi, Yadullah Sabiriyan and Rahim Rahimian)
description: Kamran Lotfi, Yadullah Sabiriyan and Rahim Rahimian (not pictured) were executed in Tehran

title: Asadu’llah Kamil-Muqaddam died in prison
description: Asadu’llah Kamil-Muqaddam died while imprisoned in Tehran

title: 2 Men executed in Tabriz (Maqsud Alizadeh and Jalal Payravi)
description:
Maqsud Alizadeh and Jalal Payravi  were executed in Tabriz. 

Both men had been detained for over 2 years.

title: Nusratullah Vahdat executed
description: Nusratullah Vahdat was executed in Mashhad.

title: Ihsanullah Kathiri executed
description: Ihsanullah Kathiri was executed in Tehran

title: Attorney General demands dismissed civil servants to pay back all wages
description: Iran's Attorney General began issuing summonses and demanding all dismissed civil servants to repay salaries they had received, or risk imprisonment.

title: Manuchihr Ruhi executed
description:
Manuchihr Ruhi - a 52 year old pharmacist - was executed in Bojnurd (the capital of the North Khorasan province) after spending 11 months in prison.

All his properties were confiscated

title: Aminu’llah Qurbanpur died in prison
description:
Aminu’llah Qurbanpur, a 60 year old mason, died in prison. His cause of death was unknown, but his clothes were returned to his family stained with blood.

He was buried without the knowledge of his relatives.

title: Rustam Varjavandi died in prison
description: Rustam Varjavandi died while he was detained in a prison in Tehran.

title: Shapur Markazi executed
description:
Shapur Markazi, a former elected member of the National Spiritual Assembly and an Auxiliary Board Member, was executed in prison.

Mr. Markazi was subjected to severe torture while imprisoned.

title: Firuz Purdel executed
description: Firuz Purdel, an engineer, was executed in Mashhad.

title: Yunis Nawruzi-Iranzad executed
description: Yunis Nawruzi-Iranzad - a member of the Local Spiritual Assembly of Karaj - was executed by hanging.

title: Alirida Niyakan died in prison
description: Alirida Niyakan in a prison in Tabriz following 2 and a half years' imprisonment.

title: Diya’u’llah Mai’i-Uskui died in prison
description: Diya’u’llah Mai’i-Uskui died in a prison in Tabriz following 2 and a half years' imprisonment.

title: Farhad Asdaqi executed
description:
Farhad Asdaqi was executed in Tehran following 4 months' imprisonment.

Mr Asqadi was subjected to severe torture during his period of incarceration

title: 6 LSA members executed
description: Firuz Athari, Jamal Kashani, Ghulam-Husayn Farhand, ‘Inayatu’llah Haqiqi, Jamshid Pur-Ustadkar and Rúhu’llah Ta’lim were executed.

title: Ruhullah Hasuri executed
description: Ruhullah Hasuri, a 35 year old Baha'i, was shot dead in prison.

title: Ruhu'llah Bahramshahi executed
description: Ruhu'llah Bahramshahi, aged 50, was executed in Yazd

title: Nusratu'llah Subhani executed
description: Nusratu'llah Subhani was executed in Tehran.

title: Abbas Idilkhani executed
description:
45 year old Abbas Idilkhani , who was an air conditioning technician by profession, was executed in Tehran. 

Mr. Idilkhani had been imprisoned since April 1982.

title: Rahmatu'llah Vujdani executed
description: Rahmatu'llah Vujdani, a 57 year old teacher, was executed by firing squad in Bandar-e Abbas. He an elected Local Spiritual Assembly member

title: Nur’ud-Din Taifi died in prison
description: Nur’ud-Din Taifi died in prison

title: Azizu'llah Ashjari executed
description:
Following a period of incarceration that lasted over four years, Azizu'llah Ashjari (50 years old) was executed by firing squad. 

Unlike many other Baha'is, his body was given to his family following the execution.

title: Payman Subhani mobbed
description:
Payman Subhani was stoned, beaten, mutilated and thrown over a cliff.

Payman is the youngest of the 206 Baha'is who were killed since 1978.

title: Sirru'llah Vahdat-Nizami executed
description: Sirru'llah Vahdat-Nizami was executed in Tehran

title: Farid Bihmardi executed
description:
Farid Bihmardi, who served in the last National Spiritual Assembly, was executed in Tehran. He was imprisoned for a total of 22 months, 9 of which were spent in solitary confinement.

During his period of incarceration, Farid Bihmardi was subjected to severe torture.

title: Habibu'llah Muhtadi killed
description: Habibu'llah Muhtadi was killed in Tehran

title: Babak Talibi beaten to death
description: Babak Talibi was beaten to death in Karaj

title: Ahmad Kavih killed
description: Ahmad Kavih was killed in Isfahan

title: Iraj Mihdi-Nizhad mobbed/killed
description: Iraj Mihdi-Nizhad was killed by a mob in Bandar-e Abbas

title: 2 Killed in Iran (Abu'l-Qasim and Surush Jabbari)
description: Abu'l-Qasim Shayiq and Surush Jabbari were killed in Tehran

Ardishir Akhtari and Amir-Husayn Nadiri served as members in the last National Spiritual Assembly that was disbanded in 1983. 

Both men were arrested on September 11, 1984 and were tortured severely during their 3 year incarceration
title: 2 Former NSA members executed (Ardishir Akhtari Amir-Husayn Nadiri)
Mihrdad Maqsudi killed
description: Mihrdad Maqsudi was killed in Orumieh

title: 2 men executed (Bihnam Pasha'I Iradj Afshin)
description: Bihnam Pasha'i and Iradj Afshin were executed in Tehran

title: Man sentenced to 1-year imprisonment in absentia
description: Islamic Revolutionary Court of Gunabad issued a notificiation to a Baha'i of a verdict handed down during his absence, by which he was sentenced to one year's imprisonment.

title: 2 Men Arrested (Bihnam Mithaqi and Kayvan Khalajabadi)
description: Bihnam Mithaqi and Kayvan Khalajabadi were arrested by authorities, on charges arising solely from their membership in the Baha'i Faith

title: Dismissed captain denied pension
description: The Office of Insurance and Pensions of the Army stated that the pension of a dismissed captain was suspended because of his membership in the "misguided Baha'i sect"

title: Woman found guilty of "belonging to wayward Baha'i sect"
description: The Third Branch of the Islamic Revolutionary Court found a woman guilty of "belonging to the misguided Baha'i sect, of activities for its illegal administration, and of leaving the Islamic Republic of Iran". Therefore, an order was issued "to confiscate all her belongings, whether known or unknown, or whether she has registered them in her name or in the name of others".

title: Secret memorandum provided guidelines for Baha'i persecution
description: A memorandum, issued by the Supreme Revolutionary Cultural Council, and signed by Ayatollah Khameini, provided recommendations for the persecution of Baha'is in Iran
Kayvan Khalajabadi and Bihnam Mithaqi, both arrested since 1989, were sentenced to death by the Islamic Revolutionary Court
title: Death sentence pronounced against 2 men
Bahman Samandari executed
description: A day after he was summoned by authorities to Evin prison for unknown reasons, Bahman Samandari - a well-known businessman - was executed.

title: Hussain Eshraghi arrested
description: Hussain Eshraghi, an elderly Baha'i, was arrested arbitrarily from his home in Isfahan.

title: 4 women arrested in Sari
description: 3 Baha'i women were arrested after being accused of talking about the Baha'i Faith to a non-Baha'i woman. The non-Baha'i woman was arrested as well.

title: 2 women arrested
description:
A Baha'i woman was arrested after being accused of talking about her faith to her non-Baha'i friend.

Her friend was arrested with her as well.

title: Ruhu'llah Ghedami
description: Ruhu'llah Ghedami was brutally murdered by two members of the "Disciplinary Forces" of the Government.

title: Hassan Mahboubi run over
description: Hassan Mahboubi, a prominent leader of the Baha'i community, was run under suspicious circumstances.

title: Cemetery in Tehran desecrated
description:
Under orders from municipal authorities, a section of the Baha'i cemetery in Tehran was excavated, in order to construct an Islamic cultural center. 

It is estimated that 15,000 graves were desecrated

title: Ramidan-Ali Dhulfaqari arrested
description: Authorities arrested Ramidan-Ali Dhulfaqari and charged him with apostasy, a charge that carries a death sentence.

title: 2 men sentenced to execution
description: Accused of collaborating with the United Nations, Bihnam Mithaqi and Kayvan Khalajabadi were sentenced to execution by the Islamic Revolutionary Council

title: Musa Talibi sentenced to imprisonment
description: Musa Talibi, arrested on June '94, was sentenced to 10 years' imprisonment on unknown charges

title: Musa Talibi arrested
description: Musa Talibi arrested

title: Shirvan Fallah killed
description: Shirvan Fallah was killed in Arak

title: Dhabihullah Mahrami sentenced to executions
description:
Charged with apostasy, Dhabihullah Mahrami, was sentenced to execution by a Revolutionary Court in the city of Yazd.

As his heirs weren't Muslims, all his properties were confiscated

title: 2 men arrested while conducting children's classes
description: Two men were arrested in while conducting a children's class. Charges against them included being active in the Baha'i community, gathering for Baha'i meetings in a private house, and working against the country's security by organizing a children's art exhibit.

title: Mansur Haddadan arrested
description:
While conducting a children's art exhibition, Mansur Haddadan was arrested by authorities.

He was subsequently charged with "being active in the Baha'i community, of gathering for Baha'i meetings in a private house and of working against the country's security by organizing a children's art exhibit" and imprisoned for 3 years

title: Musa Talibi sentenced to execution
description: Imprisoned since June 1994, Musa Talibi was sentenced to execution for apostasy.

title: Death sentence against Musa Talibi confirmed
description: The Supreme Court of Iran confirmed the execution sentence against Musa Talibi (arrested since 1994), under charges of apostasy.

title: Mansur Dawlat killed
description: Mansur Dawlat was killed in Kerman.

title: Masha'llah Enayati killed
description:
While visiting his native village of Ardistan, Masha'llah Enayati - a resident of Tehran - was arrested and sent to prison in Isfahan.

For a whole week, he was severely beaten while in custody, and he passed away later due to the injuries he sustained

title: Shahram Reza'i killed
description:
Shahram Reza'i, a young Baha'i serving as a conscript in the army, was shot in the head by his superior officer and died the following day. 

The officer was soon released after it was learned that the dead soldier was a Baha'i, and instructed to pay the price of 3 bullets used to kill Shahram.

Shahram was the 7th Baha'i to have been slain by officers or fellow soldiers

title: 2 men arrested (Sirus Dhabihi-Muqaddam and Hedayatollah Kashifi-Najafabadi) charged with converting a woman
description:
Sirus Dhabihi-Muqaddam and Hedayatollah Kashifi-Najafabadi were arrested in Mashhad in, on charges of being involved in the conversion of a Muslim woman to the Baha'i faith.

The woman denied the claims, affirming she was born into a Baha'i family

title: Youth class raided; teachers and students arrested
description:
Authorities in Mashhad raided the home of Manuchehr Ziyai, where a class for youth was being held. He was arrested along with the teacher, Sonia Ahmadi, and 12 students aged 15-16.

Ms. Ahmadi and Mr Ziyai were subsequently sentenced to 3 years imprisonment, while the youth were handed 3 years' suspended sentences.

title: Rúhullah Rawhani executed
description:
Imprisoned since September 1997, Rúhullah Rawhani- a father of four, was executed in Iran, under the charges of converting a Muslim to the Baha'i faith. 

The woman he is accused of converting denies the charges, stating she was raised as a Baha'i. She was not arrested.

Rawhani was not provided access to a lawyer, and no sentence was ever pronounced.

title: Baha'i Institute of Higher Education raided
description:
The Baha'i Insitute of Higher Education, a university managed by the Baha'i community, was closed. 

Members of the Ministry of Intelligence raided over 500 homes, confiscating textbooks and teaching equipment.

36 members of faculty were arrested

title: Kamal Yazdan-Panah arrested
description:
Following a raid on his home, Kamal Yazdan-Panah was arrested and charged with "spying for the United States, England, Israel, and the Soviet Union, as well as lies about participation in efforts to overthrow the Islamic Republic".

He was subsequently sentenced to 10 months internal exile

title: Manuchehr Khulusi arrested
description: While visiting fellow Baha'is in Birijand, Manuchehr Khulusi was arrested by authorities, and charges against him were unknown.

title: Manuchehr Khulusi sentenced to execution
description:
After a 2-day trial in September, Manuchehr Khulusi was sentenced to execution.

Although he was released in May, it is unclear whether the death sentence against him still stands.

Sirus Dhabihi-Muqaddam and Hedayat Kashefi-Najafabadi were arrested arested in late 1997 on charges of converting a woman to the Baha'i Faith.

After two previous death sentences were quashed by the Supreme Court, the death penalty was reinstated against the two.
title: Death sentence  against 2 men reinstated (Sirus Dhabihi-Muqaddam and Hedayat Kashefi-Najafabad)
Judge declares confiscation of Baha'i properties justifiable
description: A judge ruled that the “seizure and confiscation of the properties belonging to the misguided sect of Baha’ism is legally and religiously justifiable” and states that “the cultural activities of the misguided sect of Baha’ism - as prescribed by the order of His Excellency the Supreme Leader - do need to be seriously opposed”.

title: Tehran's Baha'is offered unusable cemetery
description: the Government offered the Tehran Baha'i community a piece of land for use as a cemetery. However, the land was in the desert, with no access to water, making it impossible to perform Bahá'í mourning rituals. In addition the Government stipulated that no markers be put on individual graves and that no mortuary facilities be built on the site, making it impossible to perform a proper burial.

title: Heirs denied pension
description: The Office of Beneficiary Affairs of the Keshavarzi Bank instructed its General Office to discontinue the disbursement of a Bahá’í’s pension to his heirs because he was a member of the Bahá’í “sect.”

title: Business forced to cease his operations
description: Branch 13 of the Tribunal of Administrative Justice rejected an appeal by a Bahá’í businessman against an injunction that required him to cease his business operations. The court also rejected his petition to obtain a business license. The tribunal held that his appeal was “disqualified as irrelevant, as [it was] outside the scope of the applicable regulations,” citing the information the court had “about the plaintiff’s being associated with the perverse Baha’i sect.”

title: Employee denied pension
description: General Office of Finance transmitted a letter to the director of the Retirement Bureau of the Province of Azerbaijan-e-Sharqi, stating that since a Bahá’í’s employment had been terminated due to his belief in “the perverse Baha’i sect,” there was no authorization to return or transfer his retirement deductions
The resting place of Mulla Muhammad-'Ali Barfurushi (known as Quddus - the Most Holy) was demolished with the knowledge of the Iranian government.
title: Holy Site destroyed
Baha'i historical site destroyed
description:
The house of Mirza Abbas Nuri, the father of the Baha'u'llah, the founder of the Baha'i faith, was destroyed.

As well as being regarded as one of Iran's greatest calligraphers, Mirza Abbas Nuri was a statesmen and prominent literary figure, and his house was regarded as a “a matchless model of art, spirituality, and architecture,”

title: Optician attacked in Hamadan
description: An optician in Hamadan was kidnapped and brutally attacked by five individuals, who threatened him with death if he did not recant his faith and convert to Islam. Local authorities were unwilling to pursue the case and a local judicial official told him "it would cost him dearly" if he chose to pursue his complaint against the assailants.

title: Students denied admission to universities
description: Although 800 Baha'i students had passed the university entrance examinations and fulfilled all requirements, a bulletin by the Educational Measurement and Evaluation Organization announced that only 10 Baha'is will be admitted.

title: Homes of 6 families confiscated
description: On orders from the prosecutor of Shiraz, homes of 6 families in Kata were confiscated

title: Cemetery in Yazd desecrated
description: Cars driven over the graves, tombstones smashed, and the remains of the interred left exposed. Two days later, a gravestone was removed and left in front of a Baha'i's home, along with a threatening letter

title: Mehran Kawsari arrested
description:
Mr. Kawsari was arrested for distributing an open letter by the Baha'i community of Iran to president Khatami. 

He was sentenced to one year imprisonment

title: 5 Arrested in Kata
description: Five Baha'is, all members of farming families whose properties had been confiscated in the village of Kata, were arrested and imprisoned, when they obeyed a summons and came to the court for hearings concerning their grievances.

title: Iran's Supreme Leader Orders the Monitoring of Bahai Activities
description: Iran's Chairman of the Command Headquarters of the Armed Forces sent out a confidential letter, by orders of Ayatollah Khameini. The letter instructed the police forces, Revolutionary Guard and Ministry of Information, to and monitor Baha'is

title: Dhabihu'llah Mahrami found dead in prison
description:
10 years after his arrest, Dhabihu'llah Mahrami was found dead in his prison cell, and the government claimed it was due to a heart attack.

Dhabihu'llah Mahrami had been sentenced to death for apostasy, but his sentence was commuted to life imprisonment following international outcry.

title: 3 Baha'is arrested in Kermanshah
description: 3 Baha'is from Kermanshah were arrested on charges of "involvement in Bahá'í activities and insulting Islam." The Government raided their homes and the homes of four others the same day and confiscated books, documents, and other items.
3 Baha'is responsible for coordinating Baha'i activities were arrested in Isfahan.
title: 3 Baha'is arrested
54 youth arrested in Shiraz
description: 54 Baha'is, most of whom were youth engaged in community services, were arrested in Shiraz, Iran. The Baha'is, who had a letter of permission from the Islamic Council of Shiraz, were working hand-in-hand with non-Baha'is on providing to under-privileged children.

title: 3 Baha'is arrested
description: Three Baha'is were arrested following a raid in which books, computers and documents were confiscated

title: Shokrollah Rahmani kidnapped
description:
Shokrollah Rahman was abducted in broad daylight in Khash, in southeastern Iran. His family reported that the police refused to investigate, despite being presented with evidence, including telephone and license plate numbers. 

Rahmani was released on November 24, 2006

title: Babak Roohi arrested
description: Babak Roohi was arrested in Mashhad for making 50 photocopies of a Baha'i book for a Bahá'í function. He was released 2 weeks later after posting bail of $34,000

title: Faizullah Roshan arrested
description: Faizullah Roshan arrested by order of the Ministry of Information, following a search of his home. He was released on January 1, 2007.

title: 2 Men Arrested (Riaz Heravi & Siamak Ebrahimi)
description: Riaz Heravi and Siamak Ebrahimi, were arrested and detained for 20 and 30 days, respectively.

title: 2 women dismissed from work
description: Two women employed in a health care centre were dismissed on orders from the Imam of Baharestan.

title: Elderly woman killed in Iran
description: Behnam Saltanat Akhzari, an 85 year old Baha'i woman, was killed by a masked intruder in her home. There is no pending prosecution

title: Shah Beygom Dehghani killed
description: Shah Beygom Dehghani, a 77 year old woman, died due to injuries she sustained after she was assaulted in her home by a masked intruder.

title: Rouhani home destroyed by fire
description: Arsonists destroyed the home of Abdu’l-Baqi Rouhani in the village of Ivil.

title: Hezbollah issues warning to Baha'is
description:
A declaration was posted in Najafabad by a group calling itself "Ummat Hezbu’llah" (God's Party).

The declaration began by calling on “elements of prostituted Baha’is”, “spies of world domination” and “foreign traitors", and warns Baha'is to remain quiet.

title: Baha'i cemetery bulldozed
description:
Over the course of 2 days, individuals destroyed a cemetery in Najafabad - on the outskirts of Isfahan, Iran - using heavy vehicles.

Prior to the destruction of the graves, 30 Baha'i families in Najafabad received threatening letters.

title: Feizollah Roshan imprisoned
description: Feizollah Roshan was imprisoned in the Iranian town of Sari. The charges brought up against him were: Teaching the Baha’i Faith, being a member of and serving the Baha’i community, and assisting Baha’i youth.

title: Man detained for reportedly collecting copies of Baha'i pamphlets
description: Foad Agah was arrested and detained by the Intelligence Ministry, reportedly in the process of collecting photocopies of Baha'i pamphlets. He was released on January 21. A Muslim friend of Agah's, Ali Karimi, was with him at the time and was also detained but released within 24 hours

title: 54 Baha'is sentenced in Iran
description:
The 54 Baha'is - mostly youth - who were arrested in May 2006 for the "crime" of providing to underprivileged children - were charged with engaging in anti-regime "propaganda".

Three were sentenced to three years imprisonment, while the remaining 51 received 1-year suspended sentences, provided they attend ourses held by the state's Islamic Propaganda Organization.

title: Two Baha'is detained
description: Police in Hamedan arrested and detained Aziz Pourhamzeh, Kamran Aghdasi, and Fathollah Khatbjavan. They reportedly remain in prison

title: Foad Ettehadolhagh interrogated
description: Intelligence Ministry authorities arrested Foad Ettehadolhagh and interrogated him about the activities of the Baha'i community in Shiraz, for which he coordinated affairs on an ad hoc basis. He was released following the interrogation

title: Baha'i home firebombed
description: A Baha'i family in the Iranian city of Shiraz were surprised whilst having dinner by the sound of breaking glass, followed by a loud explosion. After the fire was extinguished, evidence of a Molotovcocktail were collected

title: Baha'i leader in Iran arrested (Mahvash Sabet)
description: Mahvash Sabet, a leader of the Baha'i faith in Iran, was summoned by the Ministry of Intelligence to Mashhad from Tehran, allegedly for questioning.

title: Three Baha'is detained for teaching Baha'i faith (Touraj Amini, Iraj Amini, and Payman Amoui )
description: Authorities arrested Touraj Amini, Iraj Amini, and Payman Amoui on charges of teaching the Baha'i faith. Iraj Amini and Payman Amoui were released on March 10, and Touraj Amini was released on March 17.

title: Attempted torching of Baha'i in Shiraz
description: Two days after receiving threatening letters from a group that calls itself Sarbazan Gumnam Imam Zaman (the unknown soldiers of the Lord of the Age), a Baha'i in the Iranian city of Shiraz narrowly escaped an attempt to torch him.

title: Home set on fire
description: A Baha'i home was set on fire in the city of Babolsar.

title: Six Baha'i leaders arrested in Iran
description: Early in the morning, the house of six Baha'i leaders in the Iranian capital Tehran were raided, and the leaders were held without charge in the notorious Evin prison

title: 3 men arrested in Qaemshahr
description: li Ahmadi, Changiz Derakhshanian and Simin Gorji were arrested in Qaimshahr on charges of propaganda against the government. Ali Ahmadi was sentenced to 10 months in prison and one year of exile to Khalkhal. His exile was later commuted. Changiz Derakhshanian was sentenced to six months in prison. Simin Gorji was released after six months in jail.

title: Baha'is detained for burying their dead
description: Security officials arrested two officials of the Baha'i community in Isfahan and one other member of the Baha'i community, reportedly on charges of burying their dead at a particular site that had been used for the past 15 years.

title: Foad Naimi arrested
description: Foad Naimi was arrested in Sari. He was a member of the local Baha’i administrative body. He was charged with membership in the local Baha’i administrative body and actions against national security. He was sentenced to two and a half years in prison and exile to Fars province.
Mehran Bandy Amirabad was arrested at his work by Ministry of Intelligence agents.
title: Mehran Bandy Amirabad arrested
Arsonist destroy home of the Mousavi family
description: An outbuilding on the property of the Mr. and Mrs. Mousavi, elderly Baha’is living in the village of Tangriz in Fars province, was destroyed by fire when it was doused with gasoline. The Mousavis, along with their two sons who were sleeping close to the building, narrowly escaped injury when the gasoline tank used to start the fire exploded. The Mousavis believe that the perpetrator thought they were all sleeping in the hut when he set the fire. Mr. Mousavi issued a formal complaint against the person they suspected, but the legal office has declined to pursue the case because the suspect swore on the Qur’an that he was not guilty. Out of respect for the Qur’an, the Mousavis have dropped the charges.

title: Badiollah Abolfazi arrested
description: Badiollah Abolfazi, a shop owner, was arrested at his workplace in Nashtaroon (Mazandaran province) by agents of the Ministry of Intelligence and taken to Sari prison

title: Molotov cocktails thrown at Dehghani residence
description: Molotov cocktails were thrown into the front courtyard of the home of Khusraw Dehghani and his wife, Dr. Huma Agahi,

title: A Baha’i home arsoned in Kerman,
description: In the early hours of the morning, the home of a Baha'i family in the Iranian city of Kemran was burned down. Neighbours reported witnessing strange activity, and arson is expected

title: Arsonists destroy car belonging to Soheil Naeimi
description:
Arsonists on motorbikes destroyed a car belonging to a prominent Baha'i in Rafsanjan.

Soheil Naeimi, the owner of the car, and 10 other Baha’i families in the town had received threatening letters from a group calling itself the Anti-Baha’ism Movement of the Youth of Rafsanjan that, among other things, threatened jihad (holy war) against the Baha’is.

title: Mehrdad Sabetrasekh arrested
description: Mehrdad Sabetrasekh was aribitrarily arrested and held for two months. He was only released after submitting a bail of $10,000

title: Ghanavatian home raided
description:
3 officers from the Prosecutor's Office in Ahvaz searched the home of the Ghanavatian family. 

The officers claimed that complaints were lodged by neighbours regarding their “activities against the regime” and “teaching Baha’ism”.

Personal belongings and Baha'i material were confiscated during the search.

title: Iran Alleges Israeli Bahai Link
description: Resalat, a conservative Iranian daily, published a report in which the Deputy of Tehran’s General and Revolutionary Dadsara is quoted to have alleged 7 arrested Baha'i leaders admitted to links with Israel

title: Youth expelled from national Judo team
description:
A young Baha'i from Iran was expelled from the national judo team and prevented from participating in international competitions, despite having won the national junior championship.

The youth was informed by a team official that the president of the Judo Federation is also a commander in the Islamic Revolutionary Guards.

title: Badiollah Abolfazi verbally charged
description: After spending 29 days in solitary confinement (during which he was abused and humiliated), Badiollah Abolfazi was verbally informed that he will be charged with "initiating actions against the Islamic Republic".

title: Mehran Bandy Amirabad sentenced to prison
description: Mehran Bandy Amirabad, arrested on May 2008, was entenced to three and a half years in prison for conspiracy against national security, propaganda against the Islamic Republic, supporting anti-government groups, and possession of satellite equipment.

title: Peyman Rohani arrested for "teaching" the Baha'i Faith
description:
While sitting on a bench in a park in Shiraz, Peyman Rohani was joined by an elderly man who began to ask him about the Baha'i Faith.

Soon later, two policemen stopped in front of them and arrested Peyman, claiming that someone had reported him “teaching” his religion in the park

title: Petition against Baha'is in Iran launched
description: Iranian news agencies reported the launch of a petition calling for the dissolution of all Baha'i institutions in Iran.

title: Trees in Isfahan cemetery cut down
description: Trees in Isfahan cemetery cut down

title: Student expelled from High School
description:
A girl was expelled from high school, after it became known that she is a Baha'i.

The school's principal wrote to the Ministry of Education, informing them that the girl was discovered to be a Baha'i, and requested the Ministry to take the necessary actions.

title: Enayatullah Haghighat sentenced on 1 year imprisonment
description:
Enayatullah Haghighat was found guilty of “teaching against the government of Iran and insulting the sacred institutions of Islam”.

He was sentenced to one year of imprisonment, suspended for four years.

title: Arash Yazdani dismissed from work
description:
Arash Yazdani received a letter informing him that he would be dismissed from work due to his "lack of conformity". 

The move was instigated by direct order from the "Islamic guards".

title: Couple arrested (Tarazollah Allahverdi and Sonya Tebianian )
description: Tarazollah Allahverdi and Sonya Tebianian were arrested in Behshahr on charges of propaganda against the government and being in contact with the Baha’i World Center. They were subsequently transferred to Sari.

title: Desecration of cemetery in Ghaemshahr, Iran
description: The Baha’i cemetery in the town of Ghaemshahr faced an intensive destruction where approximately 80% of the graves were destroyed by bulldozers.

title: Anti-Baha'i presentations given at schools
description: Anti-Baha'i presentations were given at two high schools in Shiraz. All students from grades 11 and 12, including Baha'is, were obliged to attend; it had been announced that any student not present would have marks deducted.

title: 3 social activists detained
description:
Zoleykha Mousavi, Ruhiyyih Yazdani, and Aliaskar Ravanbakhsh were arrested. 

The three were offering classes in social and family etiquette to underprivileged children

title: Siyamak Ibrahimi arrested
description: Siyamak Ibrahimi was arrested in 2006, but released after providing a surety. Authorities arrested him illegally for the second time, and he was subsequently sentenced to 6 months imprisonment and exile.

title: Masoud Atain arrested
description: Ataian was detained in his home in Qa’emshahr by Intelligence Ministry officials on 17 November 2008. Led by an agent called Mr. Movahed, the officials searched his home, destroyed sacred pictures and confiscated holy texts, his computer and business documents.

title: Social activists sentenced to 2 years imprisonment
description:
3 social activists who were offering social and etiquette classes to underprivileged children in the Iranian city of Yasuj were sentenced to 3 years imprisonment. 

Zolaykha Mosavi, Rohieh Yazdani and Ali-Asgar Ravan-Bakhsh were charged with acting against social security

title: Woman dismissed from teaching position
description:
A psychology graduate, who was teaching at a kindergarten in kerman, was dismissed from her position as a kindergarten teacher.

The Social Welfare Organization of Kerman sent a letter to the school's management with instructions that the teacher should be dismissed, on the grounds that parents were objecting to their children being taught by a Baha

title: Soheila Motallebi Arrest
description: Agents of the Ministry of Intelligence raided the home of Soheila Motallebi, a well-known musician, and arrested her

title: Kamran Jamshid arrested
description: Kamran Jamshid, a cultural activist and book dealer, was arrested and charged with spreading information on the Baha'i Faith.

title: Rostam Behifar's residence raided
description: Residence of Rostam Behifar, a member of a group that coordinates community affairs, was raided while he was away, and all Baha'i material was confiscated.

title: 13 Baha'i homes raided in Semnan
description:
Over a three day period, 13 Baha'i homes in the city of Semnan, Iran were raided and personal belongings were confiscated. Security agents also cut phone lines and warned Baha'is from informing others about the raids.

The raids resulted in the arrest of Ms. Sahba Fana’ian

title: Peyman Roohi's residence raided
description: The residence of Peyman Roohi was raided, and all Baha'i material was confiscated.

title: Three Baha'i families harassed
description: Agents from the Ministry of Intelligence stormed 3 Baha'i homes in Qaemshahr and asked the residents to present themselves before the Ministry.

title: 5 optical shops forcibly closed
description:
5 optical shops owned by Baha'is were forcibly closed by the Public Places Supervision Office. The owners were informed that the Ministry of Health had filed a complaint against the businesses, so they had to be closed.

The Ministry of Health denied that it filed such a complaint.

title: Badiollah Abolfazli sentenced to 2 years' imprisonment
description: Badiollah Abolfazli was sentenced to 2 years' imprisonment, after being found guilty of “being an active member of the Bahá’í community”; “teaching Bahaism and being involved in activities against the Islamic Republic”; and “teaching Muslims secretly by providing them with Bahá’í materials”

title: Soha Zamani Detained
description: After raiding her home and confiscating all Baha'i material, Soha Zamani was detained by security officials.

title: Mahrooyeh Dehghani detained
description:
Mahrooyeh Dehghani had just arrived from a trip to Tehran, when security agents seized her at the bus terminal.


She was detained for several hours, during which she was interrogated and forced into signing a declaration that she would not "teach" the Baha'i Faith.

title: 9 students dismissed from university
description: 9 Baha'i students were dismissed from the University of Kerman, on the basis of their religious affiliation

title: Raids, arrests in Tehran
description: Agents raided several homes during the early morning hours and confiscated several personal belongings. The raids were followed by the arrest of 6 individuals

title: Family detained in Kish Island
description: 8 Baha'is were arrested in the tourist destination of Kish, under charges of teaching the Baha'i Faith.

title: Qaemshahr cemetery destroyed completely
description:
For the third time in a span of a few months, the Baha'i cemetery in Qaemshahr underwent massive destruction. 

Undercover agents oversaw the destruction that left the ground completely flattened.

title: 5 women arrested
description:
Authorities detain five Baha'i women. The women are: Taraneh Sanai, Shahnaz Sa’adati, Amelia Fanaian, Anisa Fanaian and Farzaneh Ahmadzadegan.

They were released on bail on the 3rd of February.

title: 10 homes raided; 2 Baha'is arrested ( Ms. Sima Eshraghi and Mr. Jaleed Vahdat)
description: Homes of 10 Baha'is who are active in the Baha'i community in Mashhad were raided, and two: Ms. Sima Eshraghi and Mr. Jaleed Vahdat were arrested

title: 3 homes attacked in Semnan
description: Unknown people attacked the apartments of three Bahai families in Semnan with Molotov cocktails. This attack did not damage family members and did not damage their property seriously.

title: Namya Haghar arrested in Tehran
description: Ministry of Intelligence officials summoned Namya Haghar for questioning, and subsequently arrested him. Currently, no information is avaialable on his whereabouts.

title: Home raided in Qaemshahr
description:
The home of Saman Sabeti, a Baha'i who was in charge of community affairs in Qaemshahr, was raided.

Personal belongings and religious books were confiscated in the process

title: Saman Sabeti Bourkheili
description: After being summoned by Ministry of Intelligence officials, Saman was arrested,

title: Semnan cemetery desecrated
description: Vandals desecrated the Baha'i cemetery of Semnan.

title: Homes in Semnan bombed
description: Two apartments, belonging to the Pirasteh and Pur-Husayni families, were attacked by Molotov cocktails in Semnan.

title: Minoo Shahriari expelled from university
description: Minoo Shahriari, an Economics student at the government-run University of Semnan, was expelled on the grounds of adhering to the Baha'i Faith

title: 3 students expelled from University of Tabriz
description:
Three medical students from the University of Shahand Tabriz were expelled from university.

University officials shut down the students' (Sina Dana, Sama Noorani, and Faraz Vazirzadeh) access to the online university registration and course selection.

title: "National Baha'i Youth of Iran" forced to suspend all activities
description: Due to pressure from the Prosecutor-General of Iran, the National Youth Committee was forced to shut down

Shirin Foroghian was arrested by agents of the Ministry of Intelligenve and transferred to Kachoi prison. 

Her husband, Adil Samimi, had been arrested on the 25th of December
title: Shirin Furughian arrested
Pooya Tebyanian arrested
description: Agents of the Ministry of Intelligence arrested Pooya Tebyanian (24 years old) from his place of work

title: Threatening graffiti sprayed onto Baha'i homes in Semnan
description: In the early morning hours, unidentified individuals spray-painted slogans and threats on the walls of several Baha'i homes in the city of Semnan.

title: 2 homes raided in Shiraz
description:
Agents of the Ministry of Intelligence raided the homes of Mr. Farhad Maasumi, and Ms. Haleh Hooshmandi. Items confiscated from their homes included: books, computers, CDs, passports and identification papers.

Both had previously received one-year suspended sentences, in relation to classes they were offering to impoverished children

Three days after their homes were raided, Farhad Maasumi Haleh Hooshmandi were summoned by security agents. 

Despite being assured that they would be released on the same day, their families were informed on the 21st of March that their arrest would last for a longer time.
title: 2 youths arrested in Shiraz
Bahnam Rouhani home raided
description: Agents of the Ministry of Intelligence raided the home of Bahnam Rouhani and confiscated several items.

title: Sahba Khademi arrested
description:
Sahba Khademi (24 years old) was arrested in Hamedan while driving to her sister's home, and taken to an unknown destination.

Sahba's home had previously been raided, and she had also been summoned to the Ministry of Intelligence

title: Ali Ehsani arrested
description:
Ali Ehsani was summoned, and verbally charged with propaganda against the regime. Due to his inability to meet the requested bail, Mr. Ehsani was transferred to prison.

In early January, Mr. Ehsani's store was broken into without warrants, and everything was confiscated from it.

title: Afshin Ehsanian arrested
description:
After being summoned by the Ministry of Intelligence, Afshin Ehsanian was arrested.

Afshin is one of the 54 youth who were arrested in 2006 for offering classes to underprivileged children.

title: Home of Yahya Hedayaty in Semnan attacked
description:
During a period of a week, the residence of Yahya Hedayaty in Semnan was attacked thrice during the night. 

The windows of his home were broken, but legal inquiries made about the incidents were fruitless

title: Sorour Sorourian arrested
description:
Sorour Sorourian (25 years old) was arrested in Hamadan. Her room was raided and several of her personal belongings were confiscated.

Sorour was released on the following day.

title: 3 Baha'is summoned in Mashhad (Soheil Nasirzadeh, Babak Rouhi, Ezzatollah Ahmadian)
description:
Soheil Nasirzadeh, Babak Rouhi, Ezzatollah Ahmadian were summoned to the Ministry of Intelligence in Mashhad, and following interrogations, were asked to sign written declarations that they will not participate in religious gatherings.

Following their refusal to sign such documents, the 3 were warned that 3-year old cases against them will be opened, and they would face imprsonment.

title: Mushafiq Samandari arrested
description:
Agents of the Ministry of Intelligence raided the home of Mushafiq Samandari and confiscated several of his personal belongings. Mushafiq was later arrested.

The arrest was reportedly due to a complaint by the parents of one of Mushafiq's friends, who stated that he is "learning about the Baha'i Faith"

title: Hassan Badhrafkan free on bail
description: assan Badhrafkan ( حسن بذرافکن ), a Bahai from Marvdasht county (in Fars Province), is reported to have been freed on bail from Adel Abad prison in Shiraz on December 21. Bail was set at 200 million tumans (59,000 euros, $US 80,000). Mr. Badhrafkan was arrested in the street on September 11, 2013, and transferred immediately to the Ministry of Intelligence’s detention facility 100, in Shiraz, where he was held for 48 days before being transferred to Adel Abad prison.

title: Emanullah Mostaqim hospitalized
description:
On January 8, Emanullah Mostaqim ( امان‌الله مستقیم ), one of the staff of the Bahai Open University (BIHE) in Iran who was serving a 5-year sentence in Raja’i Shahr prison, suffered a sudden heart complaint and was taken to Imam Khomeini hospital in Tehran.
Mr. Mostaqim also suffers from diabetes, and doctors have said that he should be under treatment in a hospital specialising in heart disease. He had an open-heart operation not long before his arrest in May 2011, and has been hospitalized several times since he was imprisoned. The forensic doctor has stated that his physical condition is such that he should not be in prison. On September 4, 2013, he was granted leave from prison on medical grounds. It is not clear from this report whether he had since returned to prison, or was still on leave when his condition required him to be hospitalized on January 8.

On April 2, Negar Mulkzadeh ( نگار ملک زاده ), a Bahai resident of Mashhad, reported to the office of the Ministry of Intelligence in response to a summons, and was arrested. It is not known where she is being held. She was one of the Bahais involved in organising a handicrafts exhibition to raise money for the disadvantaged, on February 17. Ten Bahais were arrested at the exhibition, held in a private home. To date, six have been released after one month’s detention, and four remain in prison. Their names are Houriyyeh Mohsani, Negin Ahmadiyan, Noghmeh Dhabiheyan and Shayan Tafazzoli (حوریه محسنی، نگین احمدیان، نغمه ذبیحیان و شایان تفضلی).

Update:  January 8th 2014
Negar Mulkzadeh and Behnaz Hodadzadeh (نگار ملک‌زاده و بهناز حدادزاده) have been freed from Vakil Abad prison in Mashhad. Negar Mulkzadeh and Behnaz Hodadzadeh were among 10 Baha’i arrested in connection with a handicraft exhibition in Mashhad. They were sentenced to 6 months in prison, on charges of propaganda against the regime, and entered Vakil Abad prison in Mashhad on November 17, 2013.
title: Another arrest in Mashhad (Negar Mulkzadeh)

description:
A Semnan Bahá’í, Elham Ruzbehi was sentenced to three years in jail. Elham was arrested with a group of other Bahais on March 12 2011 after a raid on her home and seizure of some personal items. Elham was also pregnant at the time. Elham was released on bail but it was reported on November 1 that she was summoned to her local Ministry of Intelligence and interrogated for 2 hours before being released. Her verdict will be determined based on that interrogation. Elham is the sister-in-law to Behram Mut’arefi who has been imprisoned since July 2010. At this time five other Bahais are serving a prison sentence in Semnan and one Bahai imprisoned in Semnan is from Tehran.

Update January 8th 2014
Elham Ruzbehi and her baby have been released from Isfahan prison on January 8, on Parole
title: Elham Ruzbehi Sentenced to Three Years
Manuchher Khalasi barred from meeting his daughters
description:
Manuchher Khalasi ( منوچهر خلوصی) was arrested at his home in Mashhad on November 29, 2013, and has now been held for more than seven weeks. He has been accused of propaganda against the regime in the form of teaching the Bahai Faith, and membership in Bahai organisations. On January 16 he was finally allowed to meet his wife, mother and father for some 30 minutes. However for reasons that are not clear, his two daughters were not allowed to meet their father. His daughters, Nika and Nava Khalusi (نیکا و نوا خلوصی ), have been sentenced to six years and 4 and a half years in prison, respectively, on charges of membership of the Bahai organisation, participation in illegal Bahai activities, and propaganda in favour of the Bahais and against the regime of the Islamic Republic. They are at present free on bail, pending the announcement of the review court’s findings on these sentences.

In 1999, Mr. Khalasi was sentenced to death for being a Bahai. This sentence was later reduced to one year in prison, by which time he had already served 19 months in prison.

Shamim Ettahadi (شمیم اتحادی), a Bahai from Yazd who was arrested during a raid on his home on March 14, has been sentenced to 5 years in prison, on charges of acting against national security and propaganda against the regime. The charges relate to his supposed responsibility for a video documenting the destruction of the Bahai cemetery in Yazd, which was shown on the Persian-language television network Manoto. He was previously arrested in August 2011, along with three other Bahai youths, who had gone walking in a mountainous area. He was sentenced to 91 days in prison, on charges of propaganda against the regime, which the review court changed to 3 years probation

Update: January 21 2014

he review court has adjusted the sentence of Shamim Ettahadi (شمیم اتحادی), a Bahai from Yazd who was arrested during a raid on his home on March 14, 2013. He was charged with propaganda against the regime, membership of Bahai organisations, insulting officials, spreading lies and having satellite receiving equipment. The charges relate to his supposed responsibility for a 4-minute video documenting the destruction of the Bahai cemetery in Yazd, which was shown on the Persian-language television network Manoto (click to view). The sentence of the lower court has been variously reported at 5 or 7 and half years in prison. The review court has changed this to 3 years in prison, 74 lashes, a two-year ban on leaving Iran, and a fine of 40 million rials (1200 euros; $US 1600). He was previously arrested in August 2011, along with three other Bahai youths who had gone walking in a mountainous area. On that occasion, he was sentenced to 91 days in prison, on charges of propaganda against the regime, which the review court changed to 3 years probation.
title: Shamim Ettahadi sentenced: 5 years
Burial of Bahais in Tabriz hindered by officials
description:
Since July, 2011, officials have been preventing the Bahais of Tabriz from washing the bodies of their loved ones, and from using coffins in their burial. Following the death of Fatemeh Zara’i (فاطمه سلطان زارعی), officials at the Wadi Rahmat cemetery in Tabriz announced that it was not permissible to wash the body, or to use a coffin for her burial — both of which are part of Bahai burial practices — and that they would not allow her to be buried. This is despite the fact that the Bahais shared in the cost of construction and maintenance of the cemetery, and had previously been buried there alongside others, without any problems. The Bahais of Tabriz have sought redress with officials at all levels, including the Municipality, the Friday Prayer leader, the cemetery’s administrators, the committee for sects and religions, the Mayor, the office of the Supreme Leader, the President of the IRI and members of parliament, but all have refused to consider the matter.

Following the death of one young Bahai, Sabet Muhammadi (ثابت محمدی), his family was told they should hand over his body, and that a burial place would be found by noon, [thus denying the family an opportunity to wash and prepare the body according to Bahai law.] In 11 previous cases, bodies were buried without being washed, and without coffins, in the town of Miandoab, about 160 km south of Tabriz. Bahai teachings do not allow either moving a body long distances for burial (more than one hour’s travel), or burying the body of a Bahai in ways contrary to the Bahai burial rites.

title: Punished for complaining: Hadjabr Firuzeyan begins his sentence
description: On January 25, Hadjabr Firuzeyan (هژبر فیروزیان) reported to Semnan prison to begin serving a 40-day sentence. He is the father of Golrokh and Shidrokh Firuzeyan (شیدرخ و گلرخ فیروزیان), who began serving 6-month sentences in Semnan prison on January 8, 2014. His name has also been reported as Hadjir Firuzeyan (هژیر فیروزیان) and on this blog as Hadjbar Firuzeyan. He complained of the physical abuse of Golrokh by a Ministry of Intelligence interrogator. During one of her interrogations, the interrogators were harsh. One interrogator stood behind her and pulled her against the back of the chair, leaving her with severe back pains and a bleeding nose. Mr. Firuzeyan informed the officer handling the case, the Prosecutor and the Chief Justice. When there was no response from them, he wrote to the President of Iran, detailing the treatment of his daughter, and also tried to present this letter to the President when he was visiting Semnan. [From the dates, it would appear this refers to President Rouhani, who promised that human rights would be respected in Iran but has not been able to improve the situation at all.] Mr. Firuzeyan was arrested by the Ministry of Intelligence and held in solitary confinement for some time. He was later fined 12 million rials (350 euros, $US 480), which was confirmed on appeal, for defaming the head of the Semnan office of the Ministry of Intelligence, Mohammad Reza Hashemian (محمد رضا هاشمیان).
